item.description:
MassBio Annual Meeting
Monday, March 21 â€“ Tuesday, March 22 2011


In 1842, the use of ether as a surgical anesthetic completely changed healthcare and ushered in a new era of treatments and therapies.

In 2003, the completion of the Human Genome Project brought about another potentially revolutionary change in healthcare and drug development: Personalized Medicine. Eight years later, we are still figuring out how to incorporate Personalized Medicine into standard clinical care.

The 2011 Mass Bio Annual Meeting will focus on Personalized Medicine - past, present and future. Leading experts will discuss successes and failures, road blocks, business models, regulatory issues and other challenges around Personalized Medicine, while also offering ideas for solutions and best practices.

We will also hear from the patients and advocacy groups - key stakeholders in developing a new model for healthcare that is proactive and preventative.

Stay tuned for more details!



Sponsorship opportunities are available! For more information, contact Lauren Laidlaw at 617-674-5100 or lauren.laidlaw@massbio.org.

http://www.massbio.or...
item.name: MassBio Annual Meeting
